entry.title: Syaoran Li (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Syaoran Li (cosplayer pictured) from the manga Cardcaptor Sakura formed the basis of two characters in a later manga; one original and one clone?

entry.title: Tinsley Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an all-male boating event on Tinsley Island was called the "Bohemian Grove of yachting"?

entry.title: Edigna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to legend, Edigna fled an arranged marriage in 1074, leaving her royal life behind to live as a hermit in a hollowed-out tree in Fürstenfeldbruck?

entry.title: Walkeria tuberosa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the bryozoan Walkeria tuberosa is sometimes referred to as Valkeria tuberosa despite being named after the Scottish natural historian John Walker?

entry.title: Michaela Goade (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Michaela Goade received the 2021 Caldecott Medal for her watercolor illustrations for We Are Water Protectors, becoming the first Indigenous artist to win the award?

entry.title: Affair of Epidamnus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that two years after the small Corinthian navy was defeated during the Affair of Epidamnus, their navy became the third largest in all of Greece?

entry.title: Octavia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Panacea Society believed in God the Father, God the Mother, Jesus the Son, and Octavia?

entry.title: that (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that?
